channel.title: *URGENT* help needed - PLEASE LOOK [unsolved]
channel.description:
I have read the stickies. Didn't find a solution so that is why I'm posting. This account was registered on Oct 26, 2006 and I have had this error before and fixed it but however, I jsut keep forgetting how... Well this is the problem: I downloaded a Runescape Classic client, and when I click the .bat file to start playing, I get the classical "'java' isn't recognized..." error. It is JAVA, not javac. Please, how do I fix this? I have Java Runtime Enviroment Update 7 installed. NO, I don't need to update to a newer version. I have in the past and it is much more laggier. If you forgot to read the above, [b]this is my error[/b]. It is JAVA not javac:
'[b]java[/b]' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue..._
This is my exact information!:
Well, this is my info: [B]PATH[/B] C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11 [b]CLASSPATH[/b] CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%; I have Java JDK 6 Update 11. Java Runtime Environment 6 update 7 (I have tried 11, too laggy). I have to open my .bat file in order for the .jar file to start up (to play a RS1 Prive Server) but when I try to open I get "java isn't recognized". Java, not javac. The .bat file to start up the .jar file is named "Start Client" and has the following (in edit): [code]@echo off title Running RebornClient java -classpath reborn.jar;data/xpp3.jar;data/xstream.jar;data/hex-string.jar;data/jmf.jar org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient pause [/code] I don't have the option to edit the .jar file. Don't let me :O. Helpz?

item.title: *URGENT* help needed - PLEASE LOOK [unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @Rare_z Rare z
item.description:
@Rare_z wrote:

go read the first post. I psoted all the information. I have JRE 6 u7 (i tried with update 11, same problem), jdk 6u11. Read thefirst post.

Read full topic

@Javac_Batch wrote:

No problem just trying to say he should’ve been more informative on which Java he had and what the EXACT problem is…

item.title: *URGENT* help needed - PLEASE LOOK [unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @meatstick meatstick
item.description:
@meatstick wrote:

[quote=“Javac Batch, post:22, topic:257999”][quote author=meatstick link=topic=340618.msg2639374#msg2639374 date=1232754430]

seriously, i really need help. i wanna fix this… someone help =s?

oh, how do i point the .bat file to my bin?

set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program files\Java\jdk1.6.0_xx

You can change the jdk1.6.0_xx to jre1.6.0_xx[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 23, 2009, 04:18:04 pm[/size][hr]By the way, if your wondering…the fix to your problem is that you need to goto environmental variables

Under System variables make a new variable with the name ‘PATH’ and the value will be ‘C:\Windows\System32’

and your done.

But WHY?! WHY?! Why are you talking about JDK?! It’s JRE

Are you a retard? Then change the classpath to JRE 1.6.0_## and change it in the .bat files.
Wow, it took you that long to tell us you had JRE?

No i’m not, you shouldn’t have stated JDK since that’s misleading him.
[/quote]
Lol, I quoted the topic starter not you. I didn’t mislead him, I assumed he had JDK like everyone else and needed help with it. If he knew I was misleading him it’s not my fault if he didn’t tell me now is it?[/quote]
Oh my bad, i’m sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: *URGENT* help needed - PLEASE LOOK [unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @meatstick meatstick
item.description:
@meatstick wrote:

Javac Batch:

Right click the .bat > edit > find the JDK and replace it with yours. Example - Let’s say it says “JDK 1.6.0_10” Replace the _## to 11 for yours.

Why the hell would he do that? He is trying to run a Java program, not compile it or something similar to that. The error is about JRE, not JDK.

I suggest contacting Sun and explain the error to them, as they have more knownledge about Java then anyone on this forum. Also if you want i could help you, as a second opinion. PM me for my MSN id.

Read full topic

CLASSPATH
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

I have Java JDK 6 Update 11. Java Runtime Environment 6 update 7 (I have tried 11, too laggy). I have to open my .bat file in order for the .jar file to start up (to play a RS1 Prive Server) but when I try to open I get “java isn’t recognized”. Java, not javac.

The .bat file to start up the .jar file is named “Start Client” and has the following (in edit):

@echo off title Running RebornClient java -classpath reborn.jar;data/xpp3.jar;data/xstream.jar;data/hex-string.jar;data/jmf.jar org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient pause

I don’t have the option to edit the .jar file. Don’t let me :O.

Helpz?

item.title: *URGENT* help needed - PLEASE LOOK [unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @Javac_Batch Javac Batch
item.description:
@Javac_Batch wrote:

Mar, that is incorrect. Your path will change. www.sun.java.com > Downloads > Java SE > JDK or JRE 1.6.0_11.

In your compiler change the current JDK or JRE _## to 11 after downloading and installing. Then on your current classpath press ‘edit’ and change it to JRE or JDK and the _##.

Read full topic

item.title: *URGENT* help needed - PLEASE LOOK [unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @marwolf marwolf
item.description:
@marwolf wrote:

I use Java SE Development Kit (JDK) 6 Update 11.

With this, you will need to update the .bat files to the following: “set JAVA_HOME=C:\Sun\SDK\jdk”

That should solve your java/javac problem. I set the path inside my .bat files because I prefer it that way instead of messing with the windows environment paths.

Download JDK from here: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp

(This does not slow down my machine)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rare_z Rare z
item.description:
@Rare_z wrote:

I have read the stickies. Didn’t find a solution so that is why I’m posting.

This account was registered on Oct 26, 2006 and I have had this error before and fixed it but however, I jsut keep forgetting how… Well this is the problem:

I downloaded a Runescape Classic client, and when I click the .bat file to start playing, I get the classical “‘java’ isn’t recognized…” error. It is JAVA, not javac. Please, how do I fix this? I have Java Runtime Enviroment Update 7 installed. NO, I don’t need to update to a newer version. I have in the past and it is much more laggier.

If you forgot to read the above, this is my error. It is JAVA not javac:

'[b]java[/b]' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue..._

This is my exact information!:

Well, this is my info:

PATH
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11

CLASSPATH
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

I have Java JDK 6 Update 11. Java Runtime Environment 6 update 7 (I have tried 11, too laggy). I have to open my .bat file in order for the .jar file to start up (to play a RS1 Prive Server) but when I try to open I get “java isn’t recognized”. Java, not javac.

The .bat file to start up the .jar file is named “Start Client” and has the following (in edit):

@echo off title Running RebornClient java -classpath reborn.jar;data/xpp3.jar;data/xstream.jar;data/hex-string.jar;data/jmf.jar org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient pause
